basics.name: Hamza Virk
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher
basics.summary: Final-year mathematics student at Hofstra University interested in algorithmic game theory, mathematical finance, and computational methods at the intersection of economics, optimization, and machine learning theory.

work.name: Hofstra University, EconCS Group
work.summary: Conducted research in algorithmic game theory and machine learning theory. Pioneered the Blind-IGT framework to resolve fundamental multiplicative scale ambiguity in bilinear inverse problems, enabling first joint recovery of reward parameters and rationality in Quantal Response Equilibria.
highlights: Developed NLS estimator and rigorously proved it achieved optimal convergence rate
Extended framework to Markov Games proving optimal rates and robustness to unknown transition dynamics

work.name: Hofstra University, Department of Mathematics
work.summary: Research in mathematical finance and stochastic processes under Dr. Yihren Wu. Established rigorous framework for arbitrage-free pricing in models with path-dependent jumps.
highlights: Solved complex measure-change problem using Girsanov's theorem and conditional Esscher transforms
Implemented Gaussian HMM on SPX and VIX data to study market dynamics and jump types

work.name: Hofstra University, Department of Economics
work.summary: Research in industrial organization and health economics under Dr. Roberto Mazzoleni. Developed game-theoretic IO model to analyze how Bertrand competition impacts antibiotic conservation.
highlights: Proved strategic conservation incentives independent of bacterial cross-resistance levels
Contrasted findings with established Cournot models

work.name: Hofstra University, Department of Mathematics
work.summary: Research in number theory and combinatorics under Dr. Eric Rowland. Characterized integer occurrences in linear recurrences, proving restrictions on consecutive terms.
highlights: Established finiteness results via p-adic logarithmic bounds
Ran computational experiments for 24+ weeks testing millions of coefficient pairs

work.name: Feinstein Institute for Medical Research, Northwell Health
work.summary: Research in biostatistics and genetic epidemiology under Dr. Majnu John. Implemented machine learning methods for confounder detection in high-dimensional genetic data.
highlights: Improved statistical power of propensity score-based method
Compared performance using extensive simulations in R and GWAS data

work.name: Hofstra University, ASPiRe REU
work.summary: Applied topological data analysis to LLM attention for hallucination detection. Developed framework comparing response persistence diagrams to prompt-grounded ones using Wasserstein distance.
highlights: Applied persistent homology to LLM attention mechanisms

publications.name: Blind-IGT: Jointly Decoding Rewards and Rationality in Entropy-Regularized Games
publications.summary: Pioneered framework to resolve multiplicative scale ambiguity in bilinear inverse problems, enabling joint recovery of reward parameters and rationality in Quantal Response Equilibria. Extended to Markov Games with optimal convergence rates.

publications.name: Arbitrage-Free Pricing with Diffusion-Dependent Jumps
publications.publisher: Under review at Journal of Stochastic Analysis
publications.summary: Established rigorous framework for arbitrage-free pricing in models with path-dependent jumps using Girsanov's theorem and conditional Esscher transforms.

publications.name: On the Properties of Second Order Linear Recurrences with Rational Coefficients
publications.publisher: Preparing submission to Journal of Integer Sequences
publications.summary: Characterized integer occurrences in linear recurrences, proving restrictions on consecutive terms and establishing finiteness results via p-adic logarithmic bounds.

publications.name: Entry Deterrence and Antibiotic Conservation under Post-Entry Bertrand Competition
publications.summary: Developed game-theoretic IO model proving that Bertrand competition universally incentivizes strategic antibiotic conservation to deter market entry, independent of cross-resistance levels.

publications.name: Improving a Propensity Score Adjustment Method in Genetic Association Studies using ML
publications.summary: Implemented machine learning methods for confounder detection and subset selection in high-dimensional genetic data, improving statistical power of propensity score-based methods.

projects.name: PerToDive for Hallucination Detection
projects.summary: Applied persistent homology to LLM attention mechanisms, developing framework to detect hallucinations by comparing response persistence diagrams to prompt-grounded ones using Wasserstein distance.
